intro: Cybianthus poeppigii, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. The plant has a bulbous root system that allows it to store water and survive in dry conditions. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, often remaining throughout the year. Cybianthus poeppigii is adapted to full sun and well-drained soils, making it a resilient species in desert environments.
